timeline.bodyText: [minor] invalidReason sounds a bit weird since this is a just exception here. If you extracted a pure reason-like object from an exception like with Reason invalidReason = ex.getReason(), it would be good.
timeline.author: komamitsu

replies.bodyText: What I meant was just "This is an IllegalArgumentException object and the actual reason is stored in this exception object's message". But surely it is wired a bit. I will rename the exception object and leave a comment to suggest it.
replies.author: serihiro

timeline.bodyText: Don't we need to check the other case like placementStrategyType.isPresent() && !placementStrategyField.isPresent()?
timeline.author: komamitsu

replies.bodyText:
It depends on what kind of placementStrategyType users use. E.g. random placement strategy does not require any fields.
It's complicated a little, some placementStrategyType requires placementStrategyField but others do not.
https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java/blob/1.11.686/aws-java-sdk-ecs/src/main/java/com/amazonaws/services/ecs/model/PlacementStrategy.java#L44-L52
But at least placementStrategyField only is a clearly invalid usage. That's the reason why I added the validation here.
Regarding more detail validations, I decided not to implement it here because it is complicated to cover all patterns as I told above. I assume digdag users who use EcsCommandExecutor have the knowledge about ECS placement strategy option.
replies.author: serihiro

timeline.bodyText: throws should be at next line
timeline.author: komamitsu

timeline.message: Leave the description about placement strategy specification
